page.title: 17WRITTLE,MARCONI WORKS
page.content: Whilst Writtle has a fascinating past, it is also very much to the fore with the latest developments in radio and telecommunications, based at the Marconi works in Lawford Lane. Indeed Writtle can proudly claim to have been in at the very beginnings of radio broadcasting. Guglielmo Marconi was an Italian inventor born in 1874 and his first wireless telegraphy factory was established in Chelmsfored in 1878. From these humble beginnings the first regular radio broadcast service in Britain began from a wooden shed in Lawford Lane, Writtle on February 14th.1922. This radio station was called '2MT WRITTLE'
